titleStmt.title: Kinetics at the delta-ferrite to gamma-austenite phase transition in steel

analytic.title: Kinetics at the delta-ferrite to gamma-austenite phase transition in steel

application.desc: GROBID - A machine learning software for extracting information from scholarly documents
application.label: unknown

startPage=-1, endPage=-1, consolidateCitations=1, consolidateHeader=1, consolidateFunders=0, includeRawAffiliations=false, includeRawCitations=true, includeRawCopyrights=false, generateTeiIds=false, generateTeiCoordinates=[], flavor=null

div.p: Mild ferritic steel has been heated in situ to 1723 K, close to melting temperature. Phse transformations can be seen from α-Fe through γ-Fe to δ-Fe. Moreover, grain coarsening is seen at advanced heating stages. Within the δ-Fe phase, the entire illuminated sample grows into a single crystal, which is distorted when cooling to the γ-Fe due to phase strain and lattice mismatch at the Kurdjumov-Sachs orientation relation. The process is repeatable upon cycling.

div.head: Presentations:
div.p: The data has been presented numerously in presentations on in-situ neutron and synchrotron studies.

monogr.title: Metals Challenged by Neutron and Synchrotron Radiation

biblStruct.note: Reference: Thermec 2021: Metals Under Evolution -followed by synchrotron and neutron radiation, YouTube, https://youtu.be/oMgvHZNNirA
